sense.gloss: tearing up and discarding (e.g. documents), destruction
annulment, cancellation, abrogation, voiding, breaking (e.g. a treaty)
reversal (of an original ruling on appeal), quashing
to break, to destroy, to demolish
to wreck, to ruin, to spoil, to damage
to be broken, to break, to fall apart, to collapse, to be destroyed, to be damaged
to fall through (of a plan, deal, etc.), to collapse, to break down (of a relationship, negotiations, etc.), to be broken off, to be ruined (of an atmosphere, one's image, etc.)
to destroy, to crush, to break by striking, to wreck
praise and censure, approval and disapproval, approbation and condemnation

sdata.j: ↑三浦↑↓みうら↓↑氏↑↓し↓はある↑週刊↑↓しゅうかん↓↑誌↑↓し↓に↑対↑↓たい↓して↑名誉↑↓めいよ↓↑毀損↑↓きそん↓の↑訴↑↓うった↓えを↑起↑↓お↓こした。
sdata.e: Mr Miura brought an action of libel against a weekly magazine.

sdata.j: ↑旧↑↓ふる↓いものを↑毀↑↓こわ↓そうとするのは↑無駄↑↓むだ↓な↑骨折↑↓こっせつ↓だ。ほんとうに↑自分↑↓じぶん↓↑等↑↓とう↓が↑新↑↓あたら↓しくなることが↑出来↑↓でき↓れば、↑旧↑↓ふる↓いものは↑既↑↓すで↓に↑毀↑↓こわ↓れている。
sdata.e: It is a waste of effort to try and destroy the old. If we can truly renew ourselves, the old will already be destroyed.

words.gloss: tearing up and discarding (e.g. documents), destruction
to break, to destroy, to demolish
